data.title: Margareta, Queen of Romania
data.meta_description: Margareta, Queen of Romania (born Princess Margareta of Romania on 26 March 1949) is the current reigning Queen of Romania. She is the eldest daughter of King Michael of Romania and Princess Anne of Bourbon-Parma. She is also a member of the Portuguese Royal Family as the brother-in-law of...
data.text:
Margareta, Queen of Romania (born Princess Margareta of Romania on 26 March 1949) is the current reigning Queen of Romania. She is the eldest daughter of King Michael of Romania and Princess Anne of Bourbon-Parma. She is also a member of the Portuguese Royal Family as the brother-in-law of Duarte III.

Life[]

In December 2007, her father declared a change to the Romanian line of succession, allowing for Margareta, her daughter, and sisters to be eligible to inherit the throne.

Marriage and Issue[]

On 28 March 1979, Margareta's engagement to Infante Miguel of Portugal was announced. The couple were married in Bucharest on 24 July 1979. Miguel and Margareta have one daughter, Anne.

Tiara Collection[]

As Queen, Margareta has access to the entirety of the Romanian Tiara Collection. Below are the tiaras that she personally owns.

Titles and Honours[]

1949-1979 Princess Margareta of Romania

1979-2007 Infanta Margareta of Portugal, Duchess of Viseu

2007-2017 Margareta, Crown Princess of Romania

2017-present Margareta, Queen of Romania

National Honours[]

Order of the Star of Romania (1979)

Order of the Crown of Romania (1967)

Order of Carol I (2007)

TBD
